alert.note: Alert for Custer (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 13 at 9:42PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM MDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest South Dakota, including the following county, Custer. * WHEN...Until 930 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 937 PM MDT, Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Water is over some roads along Battle Creek near Highway 40 and along Grace Coolidge Creek near Highway 36. Water levels along Battle Creek and Grace Coolidge Creek are expected to rise further overnight. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Squaw Creek, French Creek, Dry Creek, Murphy Ditch, Grace Coolidge Creek and Battle Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hermosa, State Game Lodge, and northeastern Custer State Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
